adjective.description: (of a sea or river) having many small waves.
examples: sea conditions are often very choppy

adjective.description: Having a disjointed or jerky quality.
examples: the choppy, electronic beat of hip hop

adjective.description: Denoting or relating to a hairstyle in which layers and sections of hair are cut at different lengths.

origin: Early 17th century (in the sense full of chaps or clefts): from chop + -y.
